meanings.definition: A device for raising or hauling objects using a crank and rope.
meanings.sent1: The sailors used the windlass to lift the heavy anchor.
meanings.sent2: The old ship had a rusty windlass for pulling up cargo.
meanings.sent3: The windlass was so strong, it could even lift a small boat!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a windlass, pulling her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The windlass creaked as it hoisted the treasure from the depths.

meanings.definition: To raise or haul something using a windlass.
meanings.sent1: They windlassed the bucket of water up from the well.
meanings.sent2: He windlasses the heavy boxes onto the truck with ease.
meanings.sent3: She windlasses her little brother up the stairs for fun.
meanings.sent4: The team windlasses the flag high up the pole during the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The workers windlass the supplies to the top of the building site.
